      void get_average()
      There is a need for many view to have the global average for a comic books ratings Given how often these are to be shown, the most "parent" of the comic versions is chosen to have the function This should allow it to be shown anywhere and everywhere easily with JSP

        public java.lang.String reportComic()
        Basic system.out report of the comic in question
        Returns:
        String with basic report of title, issue number, and the overall score

      • getComicFromDB

        public void getComicFromDB()
        Has all of the DB logic needed to get the information about the comic, as well as averages information for all users Depends on HomeFilesShow by default

      • putComicInDB

        public java.lang.String putComicInDB()
        The actual act of putting a comic in a database
        Returns:
        rtn_str is returned, though as of right now it's always blank

      • updateComicColumn

        public java.lang.String updateComicColumn(java.lang.String column,
                                 java.lang.String data)
        If just an individual column needs to be updated, like in a JSON call, this is the function to use
        Parameters:
        column - Name of the column to update
        data - Data to update to
        Returns:
        Success code

      • updateComic

        public java.lang.String updateComic()
        Update all of the base information about a Comic all at once Note: this is the BASE information NOT user set information
        Returns:
        This can probably go away really, or become a bool...

      • get_average

        public void get_average()
        There is a need for many view to have the global average for a comic books ratings Given how often these are to be shown, the most "parent" of the comic versions is chosen to have the function This should allow it to be shown anywhere and everywhere easily with JSP

      • updateUserComic

        public void updateUserComic()

        public void validate_to_zero()
        Quick and dirty validation for showing the "right" value for stars Should probably just pass each "column" of the object separately, but meh...

      • validate_var

      • create_stars_input

        public java.lang.String create_stars_input(java.lang.String var,
                                  java.lang.String c_name)
        Really only used by the JSP's, this is all the backend html to make the javascript and css work on pages where things aren't editable...
        Parameters:
        var - Name of the variable to use
        c_name - Column name
        Returns:
        The string for the stars display
